required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Serum 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D Levels in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Patients With Different Levels of Albuminuria
clinical_study.official_title: Study Whether Serum 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D Levels Could be an Indicator for Dysfunction of Renal Tubules

brief_summary.textblock: Diabetic nephropathy(DN)is a major microvascular complication of diabetes.Renal injury may be presented with the characteristics of albuminuria, and its main pathological change is glomerular sclerosis. However, both glomerular lesions such as glomerulosclerosis, glomerular basement membrane thickness and tubulointerstitial fibrosis have been found in both type 1 and type 2 diabetic patients with normal urinary albumin excretion rate, moreover the tubular injury may be the primary pathological change in diabetic renal injury not only the secondary change brought on by glomerular injury. Thus, if overt urinary albumin exists in T2DM patients, the tubular injury may be severe already. An index which is predominant, sensitive and convenient to be measured should be purposed.It is predicted that insufficient renal 1-alpha hydroxylase may play a critical role in diabetic nephropathy. Then the investigators present the presumption that the activity of renal 1-alpha hydroxylase could reflect the degrees of tubulointerstitial injury, using serum 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D level as an index.

primary_outcome.description: Urinary albumin of 24h were measured by Scientific Management of HITACHI 7600-020 Biochemical Analyzer.

secondary_outcome.measure: determination of serum vitamin D metabolites
secondary_outcome.description: Serum vitamin D metabolites were detected by VITROS ECI systerm through a ELISA methods.

clinical_study.condition: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus With Diabetic Nephropathy

arm_group.description: none extra intervention was given by the investigator
none extra intervention was given by the investigator
none extra intervention was given by the investigator

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood samples were collected after an overnight fast to evaluate glycosylated hemoglobin A1c（HbA1c）, hemoglobin (Hb), serum albumin (ALB), serum creatinine (SCR), serum urea nitrogen (BUN), uric acid (UA), serum calcium (Ca), serum phosphate (P), serum alanine transferase (ALT), serum aspartate aminotransferase (AST), serum alkaline phosphatase (ALP), serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D and 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D. Urine albumin, calcium and phosphate of 24 hour were also evaluated.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with T2DM were recruited from the general hospital of Tianjin Medical University in China .

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age ＞18 years, DM duration ＞1 year, all of the patients were predialysis
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of liver or kidney disease, malignancy, current pregnancy, extensive dermatologic disease, evidence of metabolic bone disease and hyper-/hypo- thyroidism that would affect mineral metabolism. Patients who were taking native or active vitamin D, steroids, phosphate binders, or medications that affect vitamin D metabolism were also excluded.

facility.name: General Hospital of Tianjin Medical University
